__e: I have to say, Harold, we've been working together for some time now, but you continue to surprise me.
It might surprise you to hear me say that guilt is a good thing.
The people of this town they surprise me again and again.
You may be surprised to know that I saw this ground a year ago -
It can't come as a surprise to you that, uh, dad isn't pitching in as much as he said he would.
You can't be surprised if we can't take you at your word.
I wanted to surprise you, but you were so late, we started to worry.
It may surprise you to know that I, too, have experienced fear.
And I find it, which shouldn't surprise them, but it does.
Now, would it surprise you even more if I told you that you would have my blessing to become his mistress?
Would it surprise you to learn that during the course of my internment here,
Would it surprise you to know that I've been here before?
... we can surprise even ourselves with who we've become.
After ten years, I think we deserve to let life surprise us, don't you?
Would it surprise you to know that I've been here before?
But I'm going to surprise you even more, because I'll say that the murder of the deputy Serrano was inevitable.
I mean, before you know, he might surprise all of us given half a chance, but he ain't made for them corners, man.
Will it surprise you, if we remember so much about you?
- I said surprise me, and you certainly did.
Oh, why don't we just wait till your birthday and you surprise me.
I will see her today. Commandant, for a man of the world, you surprise me.
Sometimes, you know, they just make a mistake.
So, why don't you surprise us... with something that we don't know?
You have to surprise her by talking about what she likes.
